summary: Email chain between U.S. Attorney's Office Southern District of New York personnel and Cellebrite regarding the submission of a Motorola phone for forensic unlocking as part of the Jeffrey Epstein suicide investigation. The document details the device information and coordination for lab drop-off.

persons.name: Dan Embury
persons.context: Mentioned as having been discussed with regarding the Motorola phone on August 22, 2019, in the context of the device's encryption and condition.

persons.name: Joe Marino
persons.context: Mentioned alongside Dan Embury as having been discussed with regarding the Motorola phone on August 22, 2019, as part of the forensic examination process.

connections.description: Both were discussed with regarding the technical details (encryption, condition) of the Motorola phone as part of the forensic investigation.

events.title: Phone forensic analysis request submitted
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office Southern District of New York submits a Motorola phone to Cellebrite Advanced Services for forensic unlocking and analysis as part of the Epstein suicide investigation.

keyFacts: A Motorola phone (model XT1921-5, Moto E5 Play) was submitted for forensic unlocking by the U.S. Attorney's Office Southern District of New York as part of the Jeffrey Epstein suicide investigation.
The device was encrypted with Secure Startup, and its technical details were discussed with Dan Embury and Joe Marino on August 22, 2019.
The email chain coordinates the drop-off of the phone at a lab, indicating active post-mortem evidence collection in the Epstein case.
